entry.title: How to get and farm Metal Accelerants in The First Descendant
entry.summary:
Metal Accelerants are an important resource to gather in The First Descendant if you’re looking to get characters like Gley, Lepic, Valby, and Kyle. They’re also used in crafting unique weapons, so you’re going to want to get a lot of this.
How to get Metal Accelerants in The First Descendant
To get Metal Accelerants in The First Descendant, you will have to farm the Sterile Land area of the game. Particularly, you have to farm the resource boxes and munition caches that you see scattered throughout the area.
The difficulty does not matter here. Whether you’re on the normal playthrough or on Hard, these items will still come from the boxes.
Screenshot by Destructoid
How to farm Metal Accelerants in The First Descendant
To add to how you can get Metal Accelerants, the best way to farm them is to use Bunny. Her first ability, Speed of Light, allows you to move extra fast across terrain. Using that to get through as many boxes as you can will greatly decrease the time needed to farm up the materials you need.
Additionally, her Lightning Emission ability is one of the best at clearing up mobs of enemies if anything gets in your way. It’ll also help destroy caches as you approach them. However, you do manually need to open up munition caches as you approach them.
You may also need to farm some Normal and Battlefield missions to get into areas that are accessed by playing through them.
Once you have made a round through an area in the Sterile Land, just fast-travel to an Outpost or a Temporary Safe Zone so you can either respawn the boxes or go into an entirely different location. Keep rinsing and repeating this until you feel like you have gathered enough Metal Accelerants to craft the parts you need.

entry.title: Will NBA 2K25 have crossplay and cross-progression?
entry.summary:
NBA 2K25 goes live worldwide on September 6th, and there are some technical changes to expect this time.
For starters, developers Visual Concepts are finally going to release the next-gen version on PC (a much-welcome change for PC players). This again raises the question about how crossplay and cross-progression will work in this year's game.
Will NBA 2K25 have crossplay?
In NBA 2K24, crossplay was only available on Xbox Series XlS and the PS5 consoles. Players on these consoles could play with and against each other on a unified server. In NBA 2K25, crossplay will be limited to the same consoles once again. While PCs might be getting next-gen features, they will have different servers when it comes to matchmaking.
Old-gen users of the Xbox One and PS4 will not be able to enjoy crossplay. It remains to be seen if PC might get crossplay support later in the year. Additionally, Nintendo Switch users won't have crossplay either, being an old-gen system.
Will NBA 2K25 have cross-progression?
While cross-progression support will be available, it will be extremely limited in scope. The feature will be available across systems of the same family. In simpler words, a PS4 player will be able to carry over their in-game progression to PS5 and vice versa. The same can be done by an Xbox One player if they want to switch to Xbox Series X or Series S consoles.
Naturally, there will be no cross-progression support for those playing on either the Nintendo Switch or on PC. Those versions will have their separate game servers. While you could use the same 2K account to play on consoles and PC, the progress on both platforms will be different.
While PC users will still have certain limitations compared to those on PS5 and Xbox Series XlS, the next-gen upgrade was much required. Thanks to the changes, PC players will be able to enjoy features like ProPLAY, player builder, new badges, and more across all game modes.

entry.title: How to get a Neon Pet in Adopt Me – tips and requirements
entry.summary:
Adopt Me is a cutesy slice-of-life experience in Roblox that lets you adopt and care for different pets, ranging from cats and dogs to legendary dragons and unicorns. You can also turn them into colorful neon pets, giving them a glowing effect, depending on the animal.
How to get a Neon Pet in Adopt Me
Obtaining a neon pet in Adopt Me requires visiting the Neon Cave under the Adoption Island bridge. In this cave, you'll find a fairy, Nixie, who briefly explains the story behind the cave. You'll also find a large neon pedestal where you can place four pets to receive your neon version.
To make a neon pet at the pedestal, you'll need four of the same pet, fully grown. Younger pets won't work for this; you'll have to wait until they reach their sixth and final growth stage before bringing them to the Neon Cave. Needing four of the same pet also means you can't mix and match animals, making obtaining neon legendary or event-exclusive pets particularly challenging.
Screenshot by Destructoid
You can also make Mega Neon pets from here, which requires four of the same luminous neon pet. Mega Neon is similar to regular neon, with your animal's glowing pattern having a rainbow effect instead of its single color shade. Think of this as the final upgrade for your pets. Fortunately, Adopt Me has reward codes you can use to get money and multipliers to make everything easier.
Where to find the Neon Cave in Adopt Me
The Neon Cave is hidden underneath the large bridge connecting Adoption Island to the Neighborhood. If you're in the Neighborhood, you'll have to exit the main tunnel to enter Adoption Island before swimming under the bridge.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Once you go under the bridge, you'll find a small opening leading you into Neon Cave. From here, it's just a short run to the neon pedestal and Nixie, where you can freely use your four fully-grown pets to create a neon version.

entry.title: Once Human: How to move your territory
entry.summary:
Your territory is home base in Once Human. You’ll probably be returning there before and after every excursion. Your journey, however, will take you all across the big world, so there’s no need for it to stay planted.
There are a lot of reasons for why you might want to move your territory. You may want to move it so it’s closer to the region where you’re currently tackling missions. Or maybe you’ve found a nicer spot with a better view where you’d like to plant some roots. Thankfully, actually moving your base is easy. So easy that there really isn’t any reason not to.
To move your territory, simply go into the build mode (B button) in any region of the map that isn’t a stronghold or active enemy area. You will then get a list of actions and what button they’re assigned to. By default, Z is what you use to relocate your territory. Press that, and an outline of your base will appear, allowing you to select an available and valid spot to build it.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Here are a couple of things to keep in mind:
Your base will always be moved complete, so you don’t need to rebuild anything.
You don’t need to spend any components to make the move.
As such, there’s no reason to be afraid to move your base. Even if you decide that you’re not enjoying the new spot or feel that your old location was better, you can simply repeat the process to put it back where it was. It’s easy once you know how to do it.

Developer Yeo (real name Vadim Gilyazetdinov), hailing from Moscow, has coded several titles of a similar ilk, known collectively as his Existential Dilogy. The former titles, The Friends of Ringo Ishikawa (2018) and Arrest of a Stone Buddha (2020) also borrowed from the Kunio-kun format. While notable for their experimentation and ambition, it feels like everything Yeo was seeking to perfect has come to fruition in his latest title, Fading Afternoon. entry.title: Frostpunk 2 Delayed To September
entry.summary: Frostpunk 2 has been delayed. Originally slated to launch next month on July 25, the upcoming narrative-driven city-builder is now arriving on September 20. Developer 11 Bit Studios sates that following a recent beta, the team wants to take extra time addressing feedback to ensure the best possible experience. In a press release, design director Jakub Stokalski and art director Lukasz Juszczyk issued the following statement: “Based on the surveys we received after playing Beta, the average rating you gave us was 8 out of 10. We’re super grateful for that! At the same time, it was only a small slice of a work-in-progress, still-growing game. While our backlog is plentiful, it was an opportunity for us to listen to what you enjoyed, and what didn’t quite land yet”. “This allowed us to prioritise things better, and bring upfront the features and modifications we were already working on. But we also realised that to guarantee the best possible experience on launch, we need more time to finish the development of Frostpunk 2. That’s why we made the difficult decision to postpone its release to September 20th, 2024”. 11 Bit States that it plans to work on new additions to existing game mechanics and improve the UI and UX, among other things. Frostpunk 2 will launch first for PC on September 20. PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S versions are planned to arrive later. entry.title: The Latest Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree Update Should Make Your Journey A Bit Easier
entry.summary:
The one and only Elden Ring expansion we're getting, Shadow of the Erdtree, launched last week and thousands of Tarnished went to the shadow realm to take on dozens of new enemies, bosses, and more. Now, just a few days later, developer From Software has released a new patch for the game that should make Shadow of the Erdtree a bit easier. Now live, Calibration Update 1.12.2 targets the scaling of the attack and damage negation given to players with each Shadow Realm Blessing upgrade. Here's what's changed: The attack and damage negation has been increased for the first half of the maximum amount of Blessing enhancements, and the second half will now be more gradual. The attack and damage negation granted by the final level of Blessing enhancements has been slightly increased.
This patch should apply automatically like any other Elden Ring update but if it doesn't – the Calibration Version listed at the bottom right reads "1.12.2" if it has – select "LOGIN" and that will apply the latest version of the game. The only other thing this update contains is word from From Software on a confirmed bug where the raytracing settings of Shadow of the Erdtree are automatically enabled (if you've previously loaded save data from previous game versions), which is causing framerate issues for some players. If you're encountering said issues, check to see if you have raytracing on or off in the game's system graphical settings. This patch arrives after one that hit the game last week, which added new hairtsyles, inventory features, balance adjustments, and more to Elden Ring ahead of Shadow of the Erdtree's launch.
